document.docAuthor: Mei Qin, Junhao Huang, Enzo Colonnelli, Runzhi Zhang & Hong Wu
document.docTitle: Proscleropterus rudis Colonnelli, Qin & Huang, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species and a key to species of the genus Proscleropterus Korotyaev (Coleoptera: Curculionidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species and a key to species of the genus Proscleropterus Korotyaev (Coleoptera: Curculionidae) from China

heading.emphasis:
Proscleropterus rudis Colonnelli, Qin & Huang
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type Specimens. Holotype . ♂ ( IZCAS ), " China : Guizhou, Zunyi, Suiyang-xian, Kuankuoshui, Xiangguangshan-cun,
4 -VI- 2010
, leg. Z. Wang, IOZ(E) 1803073 ". Paratypes . 1 ♀, same data as holotype but "IOZ(E) 1803619 " ( IZCAS ); Guizhou, Zunyi, Suiyang-xian, Kuankuoshui, Jinzi-cun, 1 ♀,
3 -VI- 2010
, leg. Z. Wang, IOZ(E) 1802495 ( IZCAS ); Guizhou, Zunyi, Suiyang-xian, Kuankuoshui, Gongtong-gou, 1 ♀,
3 -VI- 2010
, leg. Z. Wang, IOZ(E) 1803089 ( IZCAS ).

Description. Male ( holotype ). LB 2.36 mm ; LR 1.03 mm ; WP 0.87 mm ; LP 0.77 mm ; WE 1.44 mm ; LE 1.54 mm . Habitus as shown in
Figures 27–29
.

caption.paragraph:
Figures 27–31.
Proscleropterus rudis
Colonnelli, Qin & Huang
,
sp. nov.
, male. 27, 29. Dorsal habitus. 28. Lateral habitus. 30. Ventrites. 31. Pygidium. Scale bars: 29–31 = 0.50 mm.

Figures 32–40.
Proscleropterus rudis
Colonnelli, Qin & Huang
,
sp. nov.
, male and female genitalia, from Guizhou, China. 32–36. Male. 32. Aedeagus, dorsal view. 33. Aedeagus, lateral view. 34. Apex of the aedeagal body, dorsal view. 35. Tegmen. 36. Sternites IX. 37–40. Female. 37. Tergite VIII. 38. Sternite VIII. 39. Coxite and stylus. 40. Spermatheca. Scale bars: 32–38 = 0.20 mm; 39–40 = 0.40 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pronotum ( Figs 27, 29 ) 1.13 times as wide as long, 0.50 times as long and 0.61 times as wide as elytra. Pronotum with lateral sides subparallel on basal half, strongly convergent at the level of the median tubercles and then subparallel on apical 2 / 5 .

caption.paragraph:
Figures 41–43. Host plant of
Proscleropterus shennongjianus
Qin & Huang
,
sp. nov.
,
Rubus eucalyptus
Focke
( Rosaceae ) from Shennongjia, Hubei, China.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Otherwise as in
P. shennongjianus Qin & Huang
,
sp. nov.
Pronotum 0.98–1.11 times as wide as long.
Elytra 0.94–1.03 times as long as wide.
Tibiae simple, not mucronate.
Ventrites I and II moderately inflated, sparsely punctured. Ventrite V with shallow median concavity. Pygidium smaller than that of male, 1.22 times wider than long.
Otherwise as in male.

Etymology. The species name is a Latin word “
rudis
” meaning “coarse”, to indicate its rougly sculptured elytra.
Biological notes. Plant association unknown.

caption.paragraph: Figures 44. Geographic distribution of Proscleropterus in China.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The new species differs from
P. shennongjianus Qin & Huang
,
sp. nov.
in having plumper body, with wider pronotum subparallel-sided on apical 2 / 5 , oval elytra with sides gradually convergent towards apex, whereas
P. shennongjianus Qin & Huang
,
sp. nov.
has more elongate body, pronotum subparallel-sided on apical half, subcordate elytra with sides evenly convergent towards apex. Moreover, the two species have different distribution of tubercles on elytral intervals.
